1.content:
You drive along a winding mountainside road, admiring the magnificent view of the Canadian wilderness mixed with the beautiful sunset. You had two weeks off from work for vacation, and you were determined to make the most of every moment of it. You had asked some locals a few towns back if there were any good places to stay in the area. They seemed hesitant to tell you, but they informed you of a place called The Pinebrook Hotel about twenty miles from there. You asked them for directions, but they refused to say anymore, telling you the place was cursed.

You brushed it off as a local superstition, as you didn't believe in such things. You eventually managed to get directions from the bartender of a local tavern, but even he warned you not to go, saying if you came out you would be completely mad! Again, you disregard his warning and head for the hotel. You've been driving for a couple hours, and your GPS isn't saying that you're getting any closer.

More confused than frustrated, you keep driving until finally you see a grand, luxurious looking hotel, college with a huge swimming pool and all the stuff you would expect a luxury resort to have. After parking your car and unloading your luggage, you enter the main lobby and are stunned by what you see. The place is lavishly decorated, complete with an enormous crystal chandelier hanging from the ceiling. But that's not what stuns you...

It's the other guests!

You see a family of humanoid cats walking across the lobby, a werewolf at the bar, and Teddy Roosevelt chatting with George Washington over in the corner, just to name a few things! You rub your eyes to make sure you're not hallucinating. Sure enough, they're all still there. You figure they must be having some kind of convention, and it's all just people in costumes. You approach the front desk, where a woman with red skin and horns is managing the check ins.

"Welcome to the Pinebrook Hotel." She says "How long will you be staying with us?" "Two weeks." You reply, and she types at her computer for a bit before handing you your room key. "Frank!" She calls, and you turn to see what could only be described as Frankenstein's monster in a bellhop outfit. "Please escort him to his room and carry his bags. " Frank grunts in response before picking up your luggage and leading you to the elevator. On the way there, you pass Marilyn Monroe and Elvis. Quite detailed costumes, you think, even the staff is dressed up.

As you reach your room, you see a humanoid cow woman in a maid's outfit exiting it. "Oh, hi there!" She says cheerfully "I hope you find your room satisfactory, I just made sure everything is perfectly clean for ya!" As she steps aside to allow you in, you see that the room is indeed in pristine condition. Frank sets your bags on your bed before giving you a little tip of his hat and leaving. After the long drive here, you are absolutely beat, and collapse on the bed for a nap.

Later on...

11.content:
The knocking at the door disturbs you from your slumber. You have been dreaming of people removing ludicrous costumes only to have more ludicrous ones beneath. You are almost glad to be awoken.

You stumble to the door and open it without really thinking.

“I am sorry, Moo-nsieur.” You step back. It is that humanoid cow-woman. What you had assumed was some bizarre costume seems very convincing this close up, especially the way the mouth moves when she speaks and the way she blinks and the way her ears twitch and her nostrils flare and the fact her hands with fingers each of which seem to end in small hooves move so freely…

“Moo-nsieur?” she asks. You stumble backwards and she follows you inside, closing the door behind her. “Are you okay? Should I call the medical staff?”

“I… yeah, no… I don’t think… What are you?” The words come out before you can stop them, and your blunt rudeness makes the house-maid stop in her tracks, hands on her wide hips, tail swishing angrily.

“I am a worker here at the Pinebrook,” she states angrily. “Your phone is off the hook, and you have a message.” She hands you a card. You take it, glancing at the phone. She’s right; you must have dislodged it before going to sleep.

Trying hard to ignore her accusing stare, you read it: You are cordially invited to dinner this evening with Dr Acula in penthouse apartment 1.

“Who is Dr Acula?” you ask, glad to change the subject.

“He is one of the investors whose money made this hotel possible,” she replies curtly. However, she makes no attempt to move.

You understand and drop your eyes. “I apologise,” you say. “I was out of line.”

She walks up to you and places a hand on your shoulder, then leans against you. “I can stay a little longer if you would like,” she whispers. She shifts her body and you feel her chest rubbing against your arm. “Six in there,” she says. “No waiting.”

You resist the temptation to scream and throw yourself out the window. “Sorry,” you say with a forced smile. “I am taken.”

“If you change your mind,” she whispers and walks to the door with an exaggerated swing of her hips, her tail sticking up a little. Her tail. Her real tail. With a final glance over her shoulder, she leaves you alone. Real. She is a real cow-woman. What…?

No. You must be imagining things.

You sit down on the edge of the bed and stare at the card in your hand. You don’t have long to make up your mind whether you are going to attend or not; it is certainly almost time for the evening meal and you are feeling rather peckish.

So, you decide to…

15.content:
By the time you awaken, the sun has started its descent towards the horizon. You are unsure if exactly what to do, so you grab a brochure that is sitting beside the room service phone. The first thing you see is a picture of a pool. No-one is in it, but it’s a swimming pool.

Perfect. You could do with a dip.

You dress in your bathing costume, grab a towel and go outside to the glorious late afternoon air.

You stop short as you exit through the doors. Marilyn Monroe is there again, this time sun-bathing on a towel and wearing as little as possible without being classified naked. You hear a twang and look up in time to see Tarzan execute an Olympic level dive into the clean waters beneath.

You are still amazed at the detail of these costumes as you wander along to the first empty deck-side lounger you find. You drop your towel onto it. It forms the shape of a person. “Hey!” growls an angry voice from underneath it.

“Sorry,” you say as you lift it. There’s no-one there. You reach a hand out. You feel something there, but…

“Do you mind?” that voice says again, and your hand is slapped away.

You open your mouth to say something else, but a shadow falls over you. You look up as a large man swoops out of the sky, his white eagle wings folding across his back as he lands.

You just stare at this new arrival, a gaze he returns intensely. “Please leave Mr Griffin alone,” he says.

“But there’s no-one…” you start, then stop as a bottle of suntan lotion is lifted. A bit is squirted out and then it appears to cover a face before fading as it is rubbed in. “Mr Griffin?” you ask.

“Yes?” the voice growls.

“Sorry,” you mutter.

“That’s okay.” You hear the deck-side lounger creak and now you notice an indentation in it.

The winged man gently takes your elbow and guides you towards another lounger. “The Invisible Man has been a regular guest for years,” he explains. “Please do not upset him.”

“Sorry,” you repeat. Your mind is reeling. Costumes? Invisible? Flying? Cows? You had the distinct impression that Pinebrook Hotel was a lot more than it seemed.

You need a swim. That’s what’ll help. You drop your towel on the lounger indicated by the winged man, then go across to the water. It all looks fine. Tarzan is back on the diving board and the Creature from the Black Lagoon is floating on the opposite side of the pool, and you can see no-one else. You jump in.

The water feels soft and bouncy and you are lifted up high.

“Hey!” yells the winged man, who you realise must be the life-guard. “What have we told you about annoying paying guests?”

You look at him but realise he is not talking to you. He is talking to the middle of the tentacled water thing that is currently holding you aloft. You hear a blurbled response. “Well, put him down or I will get Merlin to come out here and dispel you. Simple.” You are lowered to the water and everything calms down. “Sorry about that,” the winged man says. “He likes to show off. But water elementals are remarkably good at keeping the pool clean.”

You stare at him. This is getting weirder.
15.title: You go for a dip in the pool

info.brief_description: A vacation spot unlike anything in this reality, or any other. Enjoy your stay!
info.description:
The Pinebrook Hotel is like no other vacation destination on Earth. Not because it has anything that you wouldn't expect it to have, but because of it's staff and clientele. See, nobody is exactly sure where the hotel even came from. It doesn't appear on any maps, nobody has seen any brochures for it, and nobody remembers ever hearing of it's construction. It's as if it just appeared out of nowhere! But that's not the strangest thing.

Those who have actually been to the hotel, are usually labled as insane when they leave, because of people claiming to have seen things such as real live monsters, humanoid animals and long dead historical figures and celebrities. As a result, the general consensus is that the place is cursed and most ordinary tourists avoid the place like the plague. But here's the craziest part: Those claims of monsters, anthros and famous dead people?

They're all true!

Rules

1. Feel free to add your own guests to the story. Be they mythical creature, furry, celebrity or fictional character. Plus anything in between!
2. No killing characters.
3. I may add or change rules as I see fit.

Enjoy!
